title: High PM2.5 Air Pollution
description: In 2020, Niger had a mean annual PM2.5 air pollution exposure of 85.1 micrograms per cubic meter, one of the highest in the world.

title: High Competition from Unregistered Firms
description: In 2017, 85.1% of firms in Niger reported competition from unregistered firms, indicating a significant informal sector.

title: High Contribution of Agriculture to GDP
description: In 2023, agriculture, forestry, and fishing contributed 47.8% to Niger's GDP, highlighting the sector's importance to the economy.

title: Low Coverage of Social Insurance Programs
description: In 2021, only 0.21% of Niger's population in the 3rd quintile was covered by social insurance programs, one of the lowest globally.

title: High Learning Poverty Among Female Children
description: In 2019, 100% of female children at the end-of-primary age in Niger were below minimum reading proficiency, adjusted for out-of-school children.

title: High Rate of Female Primary School Age Children Out-of-School
description: In 2019, 100% of female primary school age children in Niger were out-of-school, indicating severe educational challenges.

title: High Adolescent Out-of-School Rates
description: In 2023, 72.3% of adolescents of lower secondary school age in Niger were out of school, one of the highest rates globally.

title: High Under-5 Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, Niger had an under-5 mortality rate of 114.8 per 1,000 live births, among the highest in the world.

title: High Use of Insecticide-Treated Bed Nets
description: In 2015, 95.5% of the under-5 population in Niger used insecticide-treated bed nets, indicating strong malaria prevention efforts.

title: High Poverty Impact from Health Expenditure
description: In 2018, 78.5% of Niger's population was pushed further below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenditures.

title: High Employment to Population Ratio for Young Males
description: In 2022, the employment to population ratio for males aged 15-24 in Niger was 78.3%, indicating high youth employment.

title: Low Youth Female Unemployment Rate
description: In 2024, the unemployment rate for young females aged 15-24 in Niger was only 0.16%, one of the lowest globally.

title: High Proportion of Young Female Population
description: In 2023, 46.9% of Niger's female population was aged 0-14, indicating a very young demographic.
